definition:
The *pedal triangle* of any triangle $\triangle ABC$, is the triangle
whose vertices are the feet of perpendiculars from $A$, $B$ and $C$ to
their opposite sides in $\triangle ABC$.

In this figure, the $\triangle DEF$ is the pedal triangle of
$\triangle ABC$.

![image](triangle.1.eps)

In general, for any point $P$ inside a triangle, the *pedal triangle* of
$P$ is a triangle whose vertices are the feet of perpendiculars from $P$
to the sides of the triangle.

In the following figure, the $\triangle D'E'F'$ is the pedal triangle of
$P$ in $\triangle ABC$.

![image](triangle.2.eps)
